articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Il from Syrian President
Preparatory committee formed
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from Syrian President 
    Pyongyang, February 20 (KCNA) -- A gift was presented to General Secretary Kim Jong Il by Hafez Al Assad, general secretary of the central committee of the Arab Socialist Baath Party and President of Syria, on the occasion of his birthday.    The gift was handed to Kim Yong Nam, member of the political bureau of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea and President of the presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, by head of the delegation of the Arab Socialist Baath Party of Syria Ahmad  Kabalan, member of the Regional Leadership and director of the Peasant Department of the ASBPS.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's work published in Pakistan
Talks between secretary of WPK and chairman of PFWPSP
Anti-DPRK U.S.-Japan tie-up
articles.content:
Talks between secretary of WPK and chairman of PFWPSP
   Pyongyang, February 20 (KCNA) -- Talks between Choe Thae Bok, secretary of the Central Committee of the Worker's Party of Korea, and Genaro Ledesma Izquieta, chairman of the People's Front of Workers, Peasants and Students of Peru, were  held in Pyongyang on Feb. 19.   They informed each other of party activities and exchanged views on developing friendly relations between the two parties and matters of common concern.

articles.title: Cambodian King gives reception on Kim Jong Il's birthday
articles.content:
Anti-DPRK U.S.-Japan tie-up
   Pyongyang, February 20 (KCNA) -- An anti-DPRK confab was held by a deputy assistant secretary and the policy planning director of the U.S. State Department and the director of the Diplomatic Policy Department of the Japanese Foreign Ministry in Japan on Feb. 14, according to a news report.  The two sides reaffirmed that Japan and the United States will intensify nexus "lest North Korea should launch another missile."   this shows that the United States and Japan continue threatening the DPRK over its "missile launch."

articles.title: Kim Jong Il sends wreath to bier of Jon Yong Sik
Restructuring of "Chongwadae"
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il sends wreath to bier of Jon Yong Sik
   Pyongyang, February 20 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il sent a wreath on Friday to the bier of labour hero, Kim Il Sung Prize laureate, academician, professor and doctor Jon Yong Sik, researcher of the economics department of Kim Il Sung University, expressing deep condolences over his death.

articles.title: 25th anniversary of declaration of programme
articles.content:
Restructuring of "Chongwadae"
     Pyongyang, February 20 (KCNA) -- The present chief executive of South Korea decided to increase the present 6 chief secretaries of "Chongwadae" to 7 and intensify the function of the government chief secretary and some other chief secretaries for "political reform" and "people's unity," according to a radio report from Seoul.   A spokesman of "Chongwadae" in a television appearance said political reform was needed for "people's unity" before "Chongwadae" restructuring took place.    This shows that the present ruler intends to put in action even administrative power in a bid to expand his power base.

articles.title: Shameless and preposterous remarks
articles.content:
25th anniversary of declaration of programme
   Pyongyang, February 20 (KCNA) -- A national meeting was held here on Friday to observe the 25th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's declaration of the programme of modeling the whole society on the Juche idea, which was on February 19, Juche 63 (1974).   Present at the meeting were Kim Yong Nam, Ri Jong Ok, Pak Song Chol and other senior party, state and army officials.   Kim Ki Nam, secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) Central Committee, made a report there.   He noted that the respected Kim Jong Il in his historic work formulated the revolutionary idea of the President Kim Il Sung and declared the modeling of the whole society on the Juche idea maximum programme of the WPK.   
   It is an important work of fundamental significance in carrying to completion the cause of the leader who pioneered the cause of revolution, to formulate his revolutionary idea and, on this basis, define the action programme of the party. This work can be done only by a successor who is unfailingly loyal to the leader's idea and cause, the reporter stressed, and went on to say:   In the work the respected Kim Jong Il formulated President Kim Il Sung's revolutionary idea. It was an immortal, great historic exploit of his for the WPK, revolution, times and humankind.
   The Juche idea, a revolutionary idea fathered by the President, is a fresh and original idea reflecting the demand of the Juche era, a new era of human history, and it is an encyclopedic idea containing theories involving all the stages and areas of revolution and construction.
   Kim Jong Il in the work evidently clarified that the revolutionary idea of President Kim Il Sung is an absolutely new and original idea that should be called after his august name only. On this basis, he intelligently defined this idea as the systematized Juche idea, theory and method.   
   This is famous and flawless formulation that clarified the President's revolutionary idea is an original, revolutionary idea that is consistent with the Juche idea in its content and is, in its formation, the systematized idea, theory and method.
   As a result, the President's idea was made the guiding idea of the times which should be called after his august name only. It is an undying feat of world significance that could be performed only by Kim Jong Il    who is the successor unboundedly faithful to the President and a most prominent thinker-theoretician, the reporter stressed.

articles.title: Gifts to Kim Jong Il from foreign public figures
Secret strife between two rivals
articles.content:
Gifts to Kim Jong Il from foreign public figures 
   Pyongyang, February 20 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received gifts from public figures of different countries on the occasion of his 57th birthday.   Among them are Cati Campos, member of the political bureau of the People's Front of Workers, Peasants and Students of Peru, and P.C. Sharma, chairman of the International Study Center of the Juche mass communication of Nepal, advisor to the Defence Minister of Ecuador Alberto Molina Flores, manager Humberto Ortiz Flores of the "Voluntad" Publishing House of Ecuador and director general Nelson Ortiz Rea of television station "Tele Andina 23".

articles.title: Unveiling ceremony of hanging board "Kim Il Sung Class"
Realistic proposal for opening epochal phase
articles.content:
Unveiling ceremony of hanging board "Kim Il Sung Class"
   Pyongyang, February 20 (KCNA) -- A ceremony for unveiling hanging board "Kim Il Sung Class" was held at the 10-year middle school in Altanbulag county, Tov Province, Mongolia, on Feb. 13.   The participants laid a floral basket and bunches of flowers before the statue of the President Kim Il Sung standing at the school and paid homage to him.   At the ceremony the county administrative governor pointed to the solicitude shown by General Secretary Kim Jong Il to the school and the achievements made by the Korean people in the building of a powerful nation.   He extended warm congratulations to Kim Jong Il on his 57th birthday and wholeheartedly wished him a long life in good health.

articles.title: U.S. troops' crimes of murder condemned
Floral baskets to Kim Jong Il from Guinea
articles.content:
U.S. troops' crimes of murder condemned
   Pyongyang, February 20 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Japan mission of the National Democratic Front of South Korea made public a statement on February 15, condemning the U.S. imperialist forces of aggression for committing murders in South Korea without letup.   He said that the U.S. imperialists have committed crimes of murder, imposing painful division upon the Korean nation for more than a half century.   The present ruler of South Korea is begging for the permanent presence of the U.S. troops as the successive authorities did, he said, and stressed:   Owing to this treacherous action, the U.S. troops' crimes of murder are further encouraged.   As long as the U.S. troops remain in this land, there can be neither national sovereignty, nor human rights nor national reunification.

articles.title: Brisk election propaganda
articles.content:
Floral baskets to Kim Jong Il from Guinea
    Pyongyang, February 20 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received floral baskets from Guinean Foreign Minister Lamine Camara and president of the National Assembly of Guinea El Hadj Boubacar Biro Diallo on the occasion of his birthday.   They paid a congratulatory visit to the Korean embassy in Conakry on Feb. 11 and conveyed floral baskets to the ambassador.   The Foreign Minister said that Kim Jong Il is an outstanding leader who has wisely guided the party, the state and the army of Korea as a whole for 30 odd years.  He said the Guinean government sincerely congratulated  the Korean government and people.   The president of the National Assembly said that Kim Jong Il is a great statesman widely recognized long ago. He wholeheartedly wished him a long life in good health.

articles.title: Kumgang Temple of Koguryo
articles.content:
Brisk election propaganda
   Pyongyang, February 20 (KCNA) -- Propaganda is brisk in all parts of Korea to have elections of deputies to the provincial (municipal), city (district) and county people's assemblies scheduled for March 7, Juche 88 (1999) with a high degree of political enthusiasm and great achievements.    This propaganda is being conducted in Pyongyang and all other parts of the country in various forms and methods including explanatory talk, lectures and use of visual aids.   Propagandists are performing their assignments to encourage all voters to participate in the elections and contribute to cementing the revolutionary government as firm as a rock.   The whole country is now pervaded by the spirit of certain victory and revolutionary vigor as a result of powerful political propaganda about the undying feats performed by the President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il in the building of power.
